required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Recombinant Human Insulin-Like Growth Factor (rhIGF-1) Treatment of Short Stature Associated With IGF-1 Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Recombinant Human Insulin-Like Growth Factor (rhIGF-1) Treatment of Short Stature Associated With Primary IGF-1 Deficiency: A Multi-Center, Open Label, Concentration-Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is intended to assess the effects of once daily dosing of recombinant human insulin-like growth factor (rhIGF-1) in increasing height velocity.

detailed_description.textblock:
Growth failure associated with primary IGF-1 deficiency (IGFD). Primary IGFD is a term that has been used to describe patients with intrinsic cellular defects in growth hormone (GH) action. In this protocol, primary IGFD is defined as short stature (<-2 standard deviations [SDs] below the mean for age and gender), and abnormal serum IGF-1 (<-2 SDs below the mean for age and gender).
The trial is an open-label, concentration-controlled trial conducted at up to 20 centers throughout the United States.

primary_outcome.measure: Height Velocity From Pretreatment (Week 0) to Week 34
primary_outcome.description: Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. The subject was repositioned between each measurement. Height velocity during an interval of time is defined as the change in height during the time interval divided by the duration of the time interval. Missing Week 34 heights were imputed using the last height SD score carried forward.

Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. The subject was repositioned between each measurement. Height velocity during an interval of time is defined as the change in height during the time interval divided by the duration of the time interval. Missing Week 86 heights were imputed using the last height SD score carried forward.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD Score From Pretreatment to Week 34
secondary_outcome.description: Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. The subject was repositioned between each measurement. The SD score is calculated as the subject value minus the mean divided by the standard deviation. The mean and the standard deviation vary depending on the age and sex of the child.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Height SD Score From Pretreatment to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Subjects were repositioned between each measurement. The SD score is calculated as the patient value minus the mean divided by the standard deviation. The mean and the standard deviation vary depending on the age and sex of the child.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Bone Age From Pretreatment to Week 86 Minus Change in Chronological Age
secondary_outcome.description: Plain X-rays of the left hand and wrist were exposed for bone age appraisal. The films were sent to a central facility for standardized evaluation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Serum Concentration of IGFBP-1, IGFBP-2 and IGFBP-3 From Pretreatment to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Growth factor panels for measuring IGFBP-1, IGFBP-2 and IGFBP-3 were evaluated from screening and at each study visit up to Week 86. Inter-quartile range (Q1-Q3) is 10th to 90th percentile.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change in Serum Concentration of ALS From Pretreatment to Week 86
secondary_outcome.description: Growth factor panels for measuring ALS were evaluated from screening and at each study visit up to Week 86. Inter-quartile range (Q1-Q3) is 10th to 90th percentile.

arm_group.description: Subjects received subcutaneous injection (SC) injections of rhIGF-1 once a day.

intervention.intervention_name: rhIGF-1 (mecasermin) for a period of 86 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronological age ≥ 3
- Chronological age or bone age ≤ 12 for boys and ≤ 11 for girls
- Prepubertal at Visit 1
- Height SD score of < -2
- IGF-1 SD score of < -2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with GH, IGF-1, or other growth-influencing medications
- Growth failure associated with other identifiable causes (e.g., syndromes, chromosomal abnormality)
- Chronic illness such as diabetes, cystic fibrosis, etc.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a open-label, multi-center and single-arm study conducted at 12 investigational sites (11 active) between 12 January 2005 and 14 January 2009. A total of 45 subjects were enrolled in this study.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The screening period consisted of two-staged clinic visits for up to 6 weeks, followed by an open-label treatment period of 86 weeks.

group.title: rhIGF-1 QD
group.description: During the treatment phase (Day 1 to Week 86), subjects received subcutaneous (SC) injections of rhIGF-1 at an initial dose of 60 microgram per kilogram (mcg/kg) once daily (QD) starting on Day 1 (Visit 3). From Week 2 (Visit 4) subsequent dose adjustments were made in order to achieve the target serum IGF-1 concentration for the subject's age and sex. The maximum dose in any circumstance was 240 mcg/kg/day.

baseline.population: The Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all treated subjects.

group.title: rhIGF-1 QD
group.description: During the treatment phase (Day 1 to Week 86), subjects received SC injections of rhIGF-1 at an initial dose of 60 mcg/kg QD starting on Day 1 (Visit 3). From Week 2 (Visit 4) subsequent dose adjustments were made in order to achieve the target serum IGF-1 concentration for the subject's age and sex. The maximum dose in any circumstance was 240 mcg/kg/day.

outcome.title: Height Velocity From Week 34 to 86
outcome.description: Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. Height velocity during an interval of time is defined as the change in height during the time interval divided by the duration of the time interval. Missing Week 86 heights were imputed using the last height SD score carried forward.
outcome.population: The ITT population included all treated subjects. Only subjects in the ITT population who continued past Week 34 were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Increase in Height Velocity From Pretreatment to Week 34
outcome.description: Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. The subject was repositioned between each measurement. Height velocity during an interval of time is defined as the change in height during the time interval divided by the duration of the time interval. Missing Week 34 heights were imputed using the last height SD score carried forward.
outcome.population: Completer population included all subjects who remained on study to Week 86. Subjects who completed Week 34 were included in the analysis.

group.title: rhIGF-1 QD
group.description: During the treatment phase, subjects received subcutaneous (SC) injections of rhIGF-1 at an initial dose of 60 µg/kg QD, with subsequent dose adjustments made in order to achieve the target serum IGF-1 concentration for the subject’s age and sex. The maximum dose in any circumstance was 240 mcg/kg/day.

measure.title: Increase in Height Velocity From Pretreatment to Week 86
measure.description: Height was measured standing without shoes as the average of three measurements by the same observer using identical technique with a Harpenden or other wall mounted stadiometer. The subject was repositioned between each measurement. Height velocity during an interval of time is defined as the change in height during the time interval divided by the duration of the time interval. Missing Week 86 heights were imputed using the last height SD score carried forward.
measure.population: Completer population included all subjects who remained on study to Week 86.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment emergent adverse events were collected from Day 1 to Week 86 (approximately 21 months).

group.title: rhIGF-1 QD
group.description: During the treatment phase (Day 1 to Week 86), subjects received SC injections of rhIGF-1 at an initial dose of 60 mcg/kg QD starting on Day 1 (Visit 3). From Week 2 (Visit 4) subsequent dose adjustments were made in order to achieve the target serum IGF-1 concentration for the subject's age and sex. The maximum dose in any circumstance was 240 mcg/kg/day.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
